Collaboration

title: THESIS
text:
Set Up GitHub Repo

Create a new GitHub repository (repo) for your book project.

title: THESIS
section: From Repo Copy the HTTPS Link
text: From Repo Copy the HTTPS Link

title: THESIS
text: Create Version Control RStudio Project

title: THESIS
text: Paste the Repo Link/URL

title: THESIS
text:
Set Up RStudio Project

Create a file named _quarto.yml. It will contain the configuration settings for your book.

title: THESIS
text:
Configure _quarto.yml:
project:
  type: book

book:
  title: "My Book Title"
  author: "Author Name"
  date: "2023-10-01"
  chapters:
    - index.qmd
    - chapter1.qmd
    - chapter2.qmd

format:
  html:
    theme: cosmo
  pdf:
    documentclass: scrreprt

title: THESIS
text:
Create Conent Files

Create the content files for your chapters (e.g., index.qmd, chapter1.qmd, chapter3.qmd).
Write your content using Markdown syntax. You can also include code, figures, and othe elements.



Example index.qmd

# Introduction

Welcome to my book. This is the introduction chapter.

Example chapter1.qmd

# Chapter 1

This is the content of Chapter 1.

title: SLIDES
text:
Set Up Your Project

Create a new directory for your slides project.
Inside this directory, create a file named index.qmd. This will contain the configuration settings and content for your slides.
Quarto will use revealjs format.



Know more about revealjs: https://revealjs.com/

title: SLIDES
text:
Creating Slides
---
title: "Habits"
author: "John Doe"
format: revealjs
---

## Getting up

- Turn off alarm
- Get out of bed

## Going to sleep

- Get in bed
- Count sheep

title: SLIDES
text: Slides Overview, press o

title: SLIDES
text:
Creating Sections in Slides
---
title: "Habits"
author: "John Doe"
format: revealjs
---

# In the morning

## Getting up

- Turn off alarm
- Get out of bed

## Breakfast

- Eat eggs
- Drink coffee

# In the evening

## Dinner

- Eat spaghetti
- Drink wine

## Going to sleep

- Get in bed
- Count sheep

title: SLIDES
text: Slides Overview, press o

title: SLIDES
text:
Incremental Lists
---
title: "My Presentation"
format:
  revealjs:
    incremental: true   

---

title: SLIDES
text:
Div


::: {.incremental}

- Eat spaghetti
- Drink wine

:::

::: {.nonincremental}

- Eat spaghetti
- Drink wine

:::



Learn more about divs: https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html#sec-divs-and-spans

title: SLIDES
SLIDES
text:
Slide with a pause
## Slide with a pause

content before the pause

. . .

content after the pause

title: SLIDES
text:
Asides
## Slide Title

Slide content

::: aside
Some additional commentary of more peripheral interest.
:::

title: SLIDES
text:
Footnotes
## Slide Title

- Green ^[A footnote]
- Brown
- Purple

::: aside
Some additional commentary of more peripheral interest.
:::

title: QUARTO
text:
ü§Ø Your Turn



‚àí+
07:00



---
title: "Quarto Exercise"
author: "Your Name"
date: "today"
format: html
---

# Quarto Exercise

Welcome to this Quarto exercise! In this exercise, we will practice using YAML, text, and code chunks to create a simple document.

## Introduction

Quarto is a powerful tool for creating documents that integrate text, code, and visualizations. In this exercise, we will create a simple plot using R.

## Code Chunk

Below is a code chunk that generates a simple plot using R.

```{r}

plot(1:100)

```

title: Publish using Quarto
section: Welcome to SARA Data Science Bootcamp!
text:
Welcome to SARA Data Science Bootcamp!
Quarto is a wonderful tool for publishing websites, theses, books, articles, and much more. We want your publications to be as beautiful and elegant as lotus flowers.
This is the website for the slides of the SARA Data Science Bootcamp - ‚ÄúPublish using Quarto.‚Äù At SARA, we strongly believe in accessible data science education.
If you found our study materials useful, please give us a star on GitHub.
Star


Thank you for your support!
Email us at sara.institute.info@gmail.com \(\cdot\) Call us at 925 315 2024.

title: GITHUB

title: GITHUB
text: üò¢

title: GITHUB
text:
Version Control


Version control is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later. (Atlassian 2025)



Version control is like a time machine for your files. It keeps track of all the changes made to your documents, code, or any other files over time. (Le Chat)

title: GITHUB
text:
üòç Why use Version Control?

Avoid Losing Work:

Ever accidentally deleted something important? With version control, you can easily recover previous versions of your files.

Collaborate Easily:

Working with a team? Version control allows multiple people to work on the same project without overwriting each other‚Äôs changes.

Track Changes:

Know exactly who made what changes and when. This is especially useful for keeping track of progress and identifying issues.

Experiment Safely:

Want to try something new without risking your current work? Version control lets you create branches to experiment with new ideas. If it doesn‚Äôt work out, you can always go back to the original version.

text: Tracking + Version in Google Docs

GitHub Sign up





Username advice

all small cases
use hyphen - to separate the words
the shorter the better
make it timeless (do not ajay-jnu, ajay-ny, ajay-microsoft)
avoid special characters
reuse from your social media
comfortable to reveal to the world

title: GITHUB
text:
Save GitHub Username in RStudio

Using Console, Install R package usethis


## install if needed (do this exactly once):
## install.packages("usethis")

library(usethis)
use_git_config(user.name = "ajay-kolii",
               user.email = "mynameajay@gmail.com")


To See Saved Credentials, Run in Terminal git config --global --list



Read more here: https://usethis.r-lib.org/articles/git-credentials.html

title: GITHUB
text:
GitHub‚Äôs Personal Access Token (PAT)


It is a way to authenticate and interact with GitHub‚Äôs API and repositories without using your username and password.

text:

library(gitcreds)
create_github_token()

Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor. Developed by John Gruber in 2004.



Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown

website-ajay/

_quarto.yml: Configuration file for your website.
index.qmd: The homepage of your website.
about.qmd: An example about page.
styles.css: Custom CSS for styling your website.

title: WEBSITE
text: Create the Homepage

title: WEBSITE
text:
Edit index.qmd
---
title: "Dr. Ajay Kumar Koli"
subtitle: "Data Science Educator <br>Co-founder of SARA"
image: images/ajay.jpeg
about:
  template: trestles
  links:
    - icon: github
      text: GitHub
      href: https://github.com/sara-institute
    - icon: linkedin
      text: LinkedIn
      href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ajay-kumar-koli/
    - icon: twitter
      text: Twitter
      href: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ajay-kumar-koli/
---

Content goes here.
